snippet: The judge’s pointed questioning underscored the difficulties for a prosecution team that has already tried two other officers without getting a conviction.
abstract: Judge Barry G Williams of Baltimore City Circuit Court presses prosecutors trying to prove Freddie Gray suffered fatal spinal injury from so-called rough ride in van driven by Officer Caesar R Goodson Jr; defense lawyer's closing argument and eyewitness accounts call rough ride theory into question.
lead_paragraph: The judge’s pointed questioning underscored the difficulties for a prosecution team that has already tried two other officers without getting a conviction.

headline.main: Judge Presses Prosecutors on ‘Rough Ride’ in Death of Freddie Gray
headline.print_headline: Judge Presses Prosecutors on ‘Rough Ride’ as Baltimore Officer’s Trial Winds Down
